text: hit up el prado recently - playground's swapped with wifi hubs! makes sense though seasoned watching gadgets instead of scoring goals lol
playgrounds where i used to hold afternoon soccer clinics are all tech-driven now... kinda miss simpler times
street fairs not same anymore either - more charging stations than food stalls lol 😔
the playground i grew up with turned into apartment blocks... kinda miss those swings
yeah i get your point - things gotta grow hey? still hard not letting nostalgia trip you up when everything feels so different now
hostin' movie nights now, gotta love leftovers

yeah having less cash means getting creative! evenings are more netflix marathons than hitting town & swapping gym memberships for workouts at local parks...who knew frugality could be so eco-friendly?

definitely feel you on those quiet spots—there’s a charm in little plazas around corners where you least expect them! gotta love stumbling onto a street soccer game or some impromptu folk music session after school hours too.

ah but let’s not forget those times when you wander into street markets - like little islands brimming with local flavors & chit-chat where everything feels more real somehow. unique vibes there can't be topped!
oh man... you think that's bad? try having street protests turn your 15-minute ride into an hour-long guessing game! gotta love those surprise city-wide parades turning everything upside down 🙄
interesting story but lemme tell ya, not all unplanned chats turn out cool – got stuck once listening to conspiracy theories till my ears bled...some adventures you just don't sign up for lol
playlist savior more like! mine's crammed with salsa bangers – lifesaver!

hit that grown-up vibe after navigating through some real tough personal stuff singlehandedly - like divorce ain't for weak hearts but man does it school you in "life". cácársele la ficha they say here... real talk!
dreamed big...life happened lol
childhood dream was pro baller—life laughs—now content shaping young athletes
was expecting more travels tbh
career shift here too - found joy coaching kids locally
yeah perks are cool, love random holidays here!
seems teaching already keeps everyday unpredictable enough lol
kinda love teaching but gotta admit it’d be nice if it paid more lol
work as pe teacher — fits well with active life goals
security's cool but mixing things up keeps you young!
health-focused habits blend seamlessly into everyday vida thanks to teaching
extra gigs during summer break help me out
budget planning helps me dodge surprises
learned budgeting hard way - save big when it’s peak season!
super relatable - always tweaking budgets here too!
financial peace > endless hustle
social pressures stack up the bills tbh
i feel ya – earlier it was just paying bills n now it's saving for more. guess priorities evolve like us huh?
retirement thoughts hit different after some life curveballs lol
social media does inflate things big time
love teaching kids sports tbh, always unpredictable like weather
not everything post college turned up roses but found something i love doing
taught me discipline but sometimes dreamt of pro sports coaching
all that fitness theory rarely beats hands-on game days
studied pe—no regrets shaping future generations through sports!
landed in pe teaching - never looked back!
chosen p.e., sometimes dreamt of more - still rewarding though
love teaching now but never saw it coming either lol
it's crazy how much le gente you work with can make or break your job satisfaction ya? part of why i dig being where i am ahora - great colleagues n' students
sounds like you found your niche - making a difference feels great!
feels right - secure job helps but dreams keep ya going
pe teachers always being seen as gym buffs right? more like motivational counselors trying not let kids turn into couch potatoes lol

haha can relate kind of but it's pushups during tv adverts instead of number crunching 😅 helps staying fit without hitting the gym every day, right? oh man our hobbies really do turn into daily routines sometimes!
yeah sports teacher here - stereotypes are stubborn
pe teacher here - totally ignored those old-school norms myself
so important to follow your excitement for tech or whatever fires you up!
girl power breaking barriers here too
gym classes ain’t just for dudes - love showing kids strength has no gender
boys into ballet are killing it in class nowadays!
taught some dudes yoga once... they're hooked now!
coaching soccer kicks stereotypes outta the park
always loved sports as a kid - now PE teacher; defy stereotypes much?
grew up running more than baking but hey you do you
as a kid played football — didn't buy into "girly" stuff then... still don’t!
loved sci-fi too along w/ sports growing up – passions stick around despite labels!
definitely time we ditch those outdated labels - sounds freeing!
oh man do i feel you! after 30 it's like they expect you to have everything figured out - casa, família, all that jazz. but reality? we're just figuring things out one step at a time aqui también!
physical ed wasn't always seen cool for women where i'm at - took some guts to pursue it regardless. went against the grain back then but now more gals are joining in which is awesome!
thought graphic design was cool 'cause no heavy stereotypes? nice! times are changing slowly where i teach - now seeing girls kick butt in sports classes breaks old norms wide open!
kids at school have all kinds of family setups nowadays – super diverse!

back when i started teaching most colleagues were dudes but now more women are hitting up careers here too! everyone's mixing it up these days - jobs aren’t tied down because you're a guy or gal anymore.
def seen more dads at school drop-offs lately
still tons sticking to old-school ways tho
totally get it – post-divorce got me back into running big time
rediscovered online forums post-split - different but good
online stuff's been real therapeutic personally
definitely noticed some big shifts when things changed - went deeper into health stuff solo during free time... lots more hiking than before & met new friends along those trails!
heard some chatter about that too - never really saw it play out persönlich though
divorce changed everything – career over romance became real quick
divorced - career & hobbies got way more attention afterward
balance shifted - more workouts less overtime
split up changed everything – new city vibe over old town traditions

definitely feel you on that tough balancing act – sometimes gotta choose whether we're chasing dreams or making sacrifices for love, no clear cut answers but so worth it when you can strike some kinda harmony!
can't shake off your roots—they peek out when you least expect it
big city dreams always pushed me - even ended up shaping careers
birthplaces definitely leave their mark – bolivia’s vibrant culture did for me!
for sure! gotta keep moving no matter where you're from
choices matter but roots run deep too
mountains over beaches any day for me - gotta love where you're at now!
high-altitude vibes shape you too
